content: 1 Paul, bondman of God, and apostle of Jesus Christ according to the faith of God’s elect, and knowledge of the truth which is according to piety;
content_old: 1 Paul, bondman of God, and apostle of Jesus Christ according to the faith of God’s elect, and knowledge of the truth which is according to piety;

content: 2 in the hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before the ages of time,
content_old: 2 in the hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before the ages of time,

content: 3 but has manifested in its own due season his word, in the proclamation with which I have been entrusted, according to the commandment of our Saviour God;
content_old: 3 but has manifested in its own due season his word, in the proclamation with which I have been entrusted, according to the commandment of our Saviour God;

content: 4 to Titus, my own child according to the faith common to us: Grace and peace from God the Father, and Christ Jesus our Saviour.
content_old: 4 to Titus, my own child according to the faith common to us: Grace and peace from God the Father, and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

content: 5 For this cause I left thee in Crete, that thou mightest go on to set right what remained unordered, and establish elders in each city, as I had ordered thee:
content_old: 5 For this cause I left thee in Crete, that thou mightest go on to set right what remained unordered, and establish elders in each city, as I had ordered thee:

content: 6 if any one be free from all charge against him, husband of one wife, having believing children not accused of excess or unruly.
content_old: 6 if any one be free from all charge against him, husband of one wife, having believing children not accused of excess or unruly.

content: 7 For the overseer must be free from all charge against him as God’s steward; not headstrong, not passionate, not disorderly through wine, not a striker, not seeking gain by base means;
content_old: 7 For the overseer must be free from all charge against him as God’s steward; not headstrong, not passionate, not disorderly through wine, not a striker, not seeking gain by base means;

content: 8 but hospitable, a lover of goodness, discreet, just, pious, temperate,
content_old: 8 but hospitable, a lover of goodness, discreet, just, pious, temperate,

content: 9 clinging to the faithful word according to the doctrine taught, that he may be able both to encourage with sound teaching and refute gainsayers.
content_old: 9 clinging to the faithful word according to the doctrine taught, that he may be able both to encourage with sound teaching and refute gainsayers.

content: 10 For there are many and disorderly vain speakers and deceivers of people’s minds, specially those of the circumcision,
content_old: 10 For there are many and disorderly vain speakers and deceivers of people’s minds, specially those of the circumcision,

content: 11 who must have their mouths stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which ought not to be taught for the sake of base gain.
content_old: 11 who must have their mouths stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which ought not to be taught for the sake of base gain.

content: 12 One of themselves, a prophet of their own, has said, Cretans are always liars, evil wild beasts, lazy gluttons.
content_old: 12 One of themselves, a prophet of their own, has said, Cretans are always liars, evil wild beasts, lazy gluttons.

content: 13 This testimony is true; for which cause rebuke them severely, that they may be sound in the faith,
content_old: 13 This testimony is true; for which cause rebuke them severely, that they may be sound in the faith,

content: 14 not turning their minds to Jewish fables and commandments of men turning away from the truth.
content_old: 14 not turning their minds to Jewish fables and commandments of men turning away from the truth.

content: 15 All things are pure to the pure; but to the defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
content_old: 15 All things are pure to the pure; but to the defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

content: 1 But do thou speak the things that become sound teaching;
content_old: 1 But do thou speak the things that become sound teaching;

content: 2 that the elder men be sober, grave, discreet, sound in faith, in love, in patience;
content_old: 2 that the elder men be sober, grave, discreet, sound in faith, in love, in patience;

content: 3 that the elder women in like manner be in deportment as becoming those who have to say to sacred things, not slanderers, not enslaved to much wine, teachers of what is right;
content_old: 3 that the elder women in like manner be in deportment as becoming those who have to say to sacred things, not slanderers, not enslaved to much wine, teachers of what is right;

content: 4 that they may admonish the young women to be attached to their husbands, to be attached to their children,
content_old: 4 that they may admonish the young women to be attached to their husbands, to be attached to their children,

content: 5 discreet, chaste, diligent in home work, good, subject to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be evil spoken of.
content_old: 5 discreet, chaste, diligent in home work, good, subject to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be evil spoken of.

content: 6 The younger men in like manner exhort to be discreet:
content_old: 6 The younger men in like manner exhort to be discreet:

content: 7 in all things affording thyself as a pattern of good works; in teaching uncorruptedness, gravity,
content_old: 7 in all things affording thyself as a pattern of good works; in teaching uncorruptedness, gravity,

content: 8 a sound word, not to be condemned; that he who is opposed may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us:
content_old: 8 a sound word, not to be condemned; that he who is opposed may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us:

content: 9 bondmen to be subject to their own masters, to make themselves acceptable in everything; not gainsaying;
content_old: 9 bondmen to be subject to their own masters, to make themselves acceptable in everything; not gainsaying;

content: 10 not robbing their masters, but shewing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the teaching which is of our Saviour God in all things.
content_old: 10 not robbing their masters, but shewing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the teaching which is of our Saviour God in all things.

content: 11 For the grace of God which carries with it salvation for all men has appeared,
content_old: 11 For the grace of God which carries with it salvation for all men has appeared,

content: 12 teaching us that, having denied impiety and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, and justly, and piously in the present course of things,
content_old: 12 teaching us that, having denied impiety and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, and justly, and piously in the present course of things,

content: 13 awaiting the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ;
content_old: 13 awaiting the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ;

content: 14 who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all lawlessness, and purify to himself a peculiar people, zealous for good works.
content_old: 14 who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all lawlessness, and purify to himself a peculiar people, zealous for good works.

content: 1 Put them in mind to be subject to rulers, to authorities, to be obedient to rule, to be ready to do every good work,
content_old: 1 Put them in mind to be subject to rulers, to authorities, to be obedient to rule, to be ready to do every good work,

content: 2 to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be mild, shewing all meekness towards all men.
content_old: 2 to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be mild, shewing all meekness towards all men.

content: 3 For we were once ourselves also without intelligence, disobedient, wandering in error, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
content_old: 3 For we were once ourselves also without intelligence, disobedient, wandering in error, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

content: 4 But when the kindness and love to man of our Saviour God appeared,
content_old: 4 But when the kindness and love to man of our Saviour God appeared,

content: 5 not on the principle of works which have been done in righteousness which we had done, but according to his own mercy he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewal of the Holy Spirit,
content_old: 5 not on the principle of works which have been done in righteousness which we had done, but according to his own mercy he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewal of the Holy Spirit,

content: 6 which he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
content_old: 6 which he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

content: 7 that, having been justified by his grace, we should become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
content_old: 7 that, having been justified by his grace, we should become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

content: 8 The word is faithful, and I desire that thou insist strenuously on these things, that they who have believed God may take care to pay diligent attention to good works. These things are good and profitable to men.
content_old: 8 The word is faithful, and I desire that thou insist strenuously on these things, that they who have believed God may take care to pay diligent attention to good works. These things are good and profitable to men.

content: 9 But foolish questions, and genealogies, and strifes, and contentions about the law, shun; for they are unprofitable and vain.
content_old: 9 But foolish questions, and genealogies, and strifes, and contentions about the law, shun; for they are unprofitable and vain.

content: 10 An heretical man after a first and second admonition have done with,
content_old: 10 An heretical man after a first and second admonition have done with,

content: 11 knowing that such a one is perverted, and sins, being self-condemned.
content_old: 11 knowing that such a one is perverted, and sins, being self-condemned.

content: 12 When I shall send Artemas to thee, or Tychicus, use diligence to come to me to Nicopolis; for I have decided to winter there.
content_old: 12 When I shall send Artemas to thee, or Tychicus, use diligence to come to me to Nicopolis; for I have decided to winter there.

content: 13 Zenas the lawyer and Apollos set forward diligently on their way, that nothing may be lacking to them;
content_old: 13 Zenas the lawyer and Apollos set forward diligently on their way, that nothing may be lacking to them;

content: 14 and let ours also learn to apply themselves to good works for necessary wants, that they may not be unfruitful.
content_old: 14 and let ours also learn to apply themselves to good works for necessary wants, that they may not be unfruitful.
